diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute gangrenous cholecystitis with perforation at the infundibulum.
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with worsening right upper quadrant abdominal pain that was aggravated by movement. Imaging studies indicated gallbladder distention, mild pericholecystic fluid, gallbladder wall thickening, and mild irregularity adjacent to the liver, suggesting significant inflammation and perforation, consistent with acute gangrenous cholecystitis.
